main event: A witness observed one dull white object descending rapidly for about three seconds in Dallas, Texas on 20 June 1956.
interesting points: The object was the size of a dime held at arm's length., The object had a greenish color and emitted a tail or trail., The sighting lasted for about three seconds before the object faded., Initial thought was that it could be a meteor due to its color and speed., There were multiple observations of similar objects in the area during this period.
witness description: civil engineer with experience in visual observations
